item.title: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“MonkeyLord81, post:5, topic:47016”]What are the exceptions?
And thanks guys, but are the X and Y for finding the bitmap right there, or the whole screen?

EDIT:
Okay, I fixed that one, but there’s still a peremeter error:

Line 300: [Error] (1094:5): Invalid number of parameters in script

My code for that area [the line 300 is in the middle].

oredropped:=0 mine; end;

Thanks people![/quote]

Put a semicolon after oredropped:=0. Can you show me your “mine” procedure?

Read full topic

item.title: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @MonkeyLord81 MonkeyLord81
item.description:
@MonkeyLord81 wrote:

What are the exceptions?
And thanks guys, but are the X and Y for finding the bitmap right there, or the whole screen?

EDIT:
Okay, I fixed that one, but there’s still a peremeter error:

Line 300: [Error] (1094:5): Invalid number of parameters in script

My code for that area [the line 300 is in the middle].

oredropped:=0 mine; end;

Thanks people!

item.title: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“MonkeyLord81, post:1, topic:47016”]The error:

Failed when compiling Line 283: [Error] (1077:1): Invalid number of parameters in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\******\********.scar[/quote]

Why did you asterisk out the files? And always end a line with a semicolon, except for some exceptions.

Read full topic

item.title: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

And heres a tip. Do you see how the error was on the line above? Every time there is a error, it will always add 1 extra line because of the fact it picked it up while it was compiling.

Read full topic

item.title: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

findbitmap(oreinv)

Should be:

findbitmap(x, y, oreinv)

Read full topic
item.source: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!

item.title: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @MonkeyLord81 MonkeyLord81
item.description:
@MonkeyLord81 wrote:

Hey, I need help with my powerminer script. This is my code for my mining procedure:

{Ore dropping} procedure drop; begin WriteLn('Dropping ore!') PickAnti; GasFinder; YellowTxtRandoms; findbitmap(oreinv) Wait(250) clikmouse2; wait(250) findbitmap(dropiron) wait(250) clikmouse; oredropped:=oredropped + 1 if findbitmap(oreinv); dropore; if findbitmap(oreinv)=false then WriteLn('Finished dropping ore! Starting to mine again...') wait(random(1000) M:=M+oredropped oredropped:=0 report; mine; end;

The error:

Failed when compiling Line 283: [Error] (1077:1): Invalid number of parameters in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\******\********.scar

The line with the error is:

YellowTxtRandoms; findbitmap(oreinv) Wait(250) <<<< here it is. clikmouse2; wait(250)

I have absolutely 0% idea why this happens.
Thanks, MonkeyLord81.

Read full topic
item.source: Invalid Number of Perimeters: NEED HELP PLEASE!
